revised_title: Application of Whitehead's Theory of Relativity to Non-Static Spherically Symmetrical Systems
tldr: The author extends Whitehead's theory of relativity to non-static, spherically symmetrical systems, constructing a new uniformly expanding homogeneous isotropic world-model. This model differs from Milne's model and special relativity, and the motion of free particles and photons in this model is investigated, deriving a formula for the law of red-shifts.
